physical_examinations.vital_signs: Blood pressure: Normal; Heart rate: 150 bpm at one clinic visit; Height: 130.3 cm; Weight: 28.6 kg
physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Mild diffuse abdominal tenderness, fullness in the left lower quadrant, no abdominal guarding or rebound tenderness.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Initially normal physical examination findings later revealed recurring abdominal pain and mild tenderness.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Normal temperature, normal physical examination, and results from chest radiograph and electrocardiogram were normal.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: After this visit, the episodes of abdominal pain became more frequent, increasing up to three or four times weekly.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Epigastric tenderness just beneath the xiphoid process, abdomen soft and nontender otherwise.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: The patient's abdominal pain recurred approximately weekly despite therapy.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Physical examination was normal one month after a prior visit.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Normal examination results were noted, but symptoms persisted shortly thereafter.
Instance of unrelenting severe abdominal pain was reported, indicating a worsening condition.
